utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How can I help you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've had, uh, worsening, uhm, shortness of breath, uhm, for the past couple of days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and, this has just been getting worse over the last couple of days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how far are you able to walk before getting shorter breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: A couple of stairs, two to three stairs.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how far were you able, to, to walk before that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hmm, I'd say about ten or eleven stairs.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had shortness of breath like this before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, uhm, six months ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, could you tell me about what happened six months ago?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah, I was feeling all, I was feeling, just like this was feeling awful. I went to the hospital. They started me on a water pill, kept me for a couple of days and then sent me back home. Uhm, they changed some of my meds, I think, increased the dose of something and yeah that's what happened.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see and have you been having, uhm, any swelling?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, Oh my goodness, it's so bad I couldn't wear my shoes this morning. It's gotten worse over the past, one month.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you, have you had any changes to your weight?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yep, gained five pounds in the past two months.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And have you had any changes to your appetite or, or diet or exercise?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I can barely exercise. I feel so short of breath. My dad's the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm, and have you had any, uh, instances where you've woke up in the middle of the night extremely short of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that happened last night, couldn't fall asleep.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Did it help, uh, sitting up?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I just went and sat on my chair and slept on the chair.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you, uh, typically have problems with shortness of breath if you lie flat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do, I have to, uh, started using two pillows.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Is this a nightly thing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's, it's fine with the two pillows now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Yeah, and have you been experiencing any cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and, uhm, how about any, any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you been having any, uh, instances feeling as though your heart's racing or beating out of your chest?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, have you had any fainting or dizziness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, have you had any wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any infectious symptoms such as uh, eye redness, eye discharge, nasal discharge or, or sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not recently, I had that about two months ago, but that got better.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, did you need antibiotics two months ago?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, just lasted a couple days and got better on its own.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see OK and, uhm, have you been having any abdominal pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about any changes to bowel habits such as diarrhea or Constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any urinary problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do, I, I uhm, I leak urine sometimes, actually quite often.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you use any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No I, I, well I do, I use a lot of medications, uhm, but I  don't remember their names. Uh, I have this blister pack and I just take everything in it. Uhm, I also I brought the list of prescriptions, I can give that to you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: For sure, yeah I could go through, go through that, uhm here, uhm so, but first, have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I have uh, heart, heart failure and uh, had two heart attacks and have high cholesterol, high blood pressure and, uh, I'm also overweight.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you know what your BMI is currently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: What's that?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So this is a measure of body mass index and, uhm, can help give an indication about weight ranges, uhm, whether, uhm, being in a healthy weight range or, uhm, a weight range that's associated with, uhm, risk of certain diseases such as high blood pressure.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I, I, I don't know. I, I've never heard of that. I, I know my weight, I could tell you that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Sure yeah.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm 250 pounds.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and yeah we can check that, uh, with your height today.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My height is 5'2".

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, thank you. And, uhm, so just looking at the medications here now, I see a variety for uhm, cardiovascular protection, so things like aspirin, beta blocker, ACE inhibitor, statin, uhm and, uhm, do you have any allergies to medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uhm, and have you had any, uh, so you mentioned surgeries to your, to your heart? Do you have a stent placed?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I had to stent put in after the first heart attack about five years ago and then another one, uh, three years ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you, have you been stable in regards to your, uh, like chest pain? Have you had any?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had chest pain. I have a, uhm, a heart doctor who, uhm, I went to see after the last hospitalization six months ago. Things were looking OK at the time. He ordered a bunch of tests. I Haven't done all of them yet.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you know, uh, by any chance, what the, uh, last ejection fraction was on your echocardiogram?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't know, I, I don't know all of that. I don't know, you have to ask my daughter, she knows much more about me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, no problem, well, we could look into, uh, some of those old, uh, older tests that you've done. OK, and, uhm, so can you tell me a little bit about your living situation currently? You mentioned your, your daughter, are you living with your daughter?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I live with my daughter. My husband passed away, uh, three years ago, and so I've just been staying with my daughter. It's just the two of us now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, I'm sorry to hear that about your husband. Uhm, are you currently, uh, like functioning independently around the home, or does your daughter help with a lot of the tasks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh, she, she, she has to help me out, uhm she has to help me out. I uhm, I sometimes need help with the showering, simply because I get really short of breath and then, so I have to stop and it's just, she's just worried that it's unsafe, so she helps me out with that. Uhm, she gets most of the things done at home. She does the groceries and everything.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see, and do you, do you smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I, I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And, do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not anymore.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you smoke marijuana or use any cannabis products?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, no, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, then, uh, do you, uhm, use any other recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, uhm, have you been around anybody who you think might have been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've just been staying at home. My daughter's been working from home too.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so uh, you haven't had much contact with, uhm.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: With others recently? OK, have you, so you haven't traveled anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, uh, and uh, and in terms of family history, has anybody had any heart or lung conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh yeah, everyone in my family has high blood pressure. My mom had a heart attack. My brother had a heart attack. My sister had a heart attack. Everyone, everyone has heart problems.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, certainly sounds like something, uh, common in the family. Has there been any other, uh, conditions that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, uhm, I, I don't, I don't think I asked. Have you had any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and or, or any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and, uh, I might have asked, but just to, to be complete, did you have any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm, so were there any other symptoms or anything else that, that I may have forgot to ask about?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't think so. It's just the, the difficulties with breathing and the swelling.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so the first thing, I'll speak to your daughter and we will, uhm, get a look at some of the old or some of the reports from, uhm, over the last several months from, and from the cardiologist you see. But it's, uh, and then, uh, also we'll get some blood work and a chest x-ray. But it is sounding like this could be a heart failure exacerbation. Which, so some of the shortness of breath, it could be coming from fluid, uhm, that has accumulated in your lungs and so, uh, we'll give you, oh, another type of water pill now, Furosemide, to try and help get rid of some of that fluid so it will help with the breathing. And in the meantime, we'll wait for the investigations to come back.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
